caption.p: Scenarios with changing environmental conditions. The average x‐location of the zone of partial migration over 100 replicate runs, with the error bars expressing standard deviations, in time after the change in survival probability was abruptly implemented in the model simulation for eight different scenarios (a, b). Change was applied 300 generations after model implementation except for the “compl‐zero” scenario. Decreased reproduction for migrants (c) was simulated in two different scenarios after demographic equilibrium was reached at generation 300. “ Compl” = initialized with individuals 1 ≤ x ≤ 100, “ migr” = 1 ≤ x ≤ 10, “ res” = 90 ≤ x ≤ 100, “ full” = initialized with 0 ≤ T ≤ 1, “ zero” = T = 0.5, “ zerofit” = T = 0.9 (migrants) and T = 0.1 (residents). a: resident winter survival increase of 20%. b: resident winter survival decreased of 20%. c: migrant reproductive success decrease of 20%
